name: Kshitij Gupta
bio: Passionate about building high-quality software that solves real problems.
brief: As a software engineer adept at harnessing data, I specialize in transforming intricate data insights into impactful, real-world solutions. My expertise spans full-stack development and data science, allowing me to innovate and drive forward-thinking projects. With a proven track record in leveraging data to enhance user experiences and streamline processes, I am dedicated to pushing the boundaries of technology to solve real-world problems efficiently and effectively.

projects.title: HackEx
projects.description: HackEx is a scalable online coding platform that supports remote code execution with custom inputs, syntax highlighting, code autocompletion, and real-time leaderboards. The platform is containerized for secure and isolated execution environments, ensuring robust performance during live contests.

projects.title: DeepFlowShield
projects.description: A machine learning-based system for detecting and classifying DDoS attacks using deep neural networks and traffic pattern analysis.

projects.title: Connectify
projects.description: Connectify is a real-time group chat application that enables users to create and join chat rooms with unique IDs. Built with Spring Boot and React.js, it leverages WebSocket for instant messaging and MongoDB for message persistence. The application ensures seamless communication with features like room management and real-time message updates.

projects.title: Musicify
projects.description: A React Native music streaming app with login/signup, custom UI, and audio controls—built for seamless user experience on mobile devices.

projects.title: Destinations
projects.description: A travel exploration app offering curated trip plans, maps, and guides, integrating API data for real-time recommendations and itineraries.

projects.title: TrustSense: Trustworthy Detection of Depression from Social Media Texts
projects.description: TrustSense is a machine learning pipeline designed to detect signs of depression in social media posts. By leveraging natural language processing techniques and transformer-based models, the system classifies user-generated content into categories such as 'not depressed', 'moderately depressed', or 'severely depressed'. The project emphasizes trustworthy AI practices, ensuring transparency and reliability in mental health assessments derived from textual data.

projects.title: The Continental
projects.description: A full-stack booking system for premium stays, inspired by 'John Wick', with secure login, dynamic listings, and admin panel functionality.

highlights: Engineered a business intelligence dashboard for 5,000+ enterprise users
Increased decision-making speed by 40% using data-driven visualizations
Optimized API queries and reduced latency by 35%, enabling 3x more concurrent users
Collaborated across product and design to deliver impactful UI/UX at scale
Integrated Razorpay and Stripe gateways for secure high-volume transactions (1K+ daily)
Automated deployment workflows with CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions
Boosted frontend Lighthouse performance score from 65 → 92
Built real-time analytics dashboard that contributed to 25% revenue growth
Developed IoT-enabled operations dashboard tailored for MSME use-cases
Reduced server response time by optimizing backend and database queries
Integrated email automation (Nodemailer) and secure media storage (Cloudinary)
Improved Google PageSpeed score and SEO metrics by 40%

education.degree: Integrated B.Tech + M.Tech in Information Technology
